snippet: While old-fashioned outlets focus on tragedy and drama, on social media, people tend to share more positive news, especially about themselves.
abstract: Researchers, using brain scans and information tracking, have found that good news can spread faster and farther than bad news on social media; finding runs counter to conventional wisdom that only negative stories receive attention from public.
lead_paragraph: While old-fashioned outlets focus on tragedy and drama, on social media, people tend to share more positive news, especially about themselves.

headline.print_headline: Good News Beats Bad on Social Networks
headline.seo: Good News Spreads Faster on Social Media
headline.main: Good News Beats Bad on Social Networks
